description: For the past four years we have contributed to the open source SpiffWorkflow.  SpiffWorkflow allows your buisness applications to process BPMN diagrams (think of them as very powerful flow charts) to accomplish what would otherwise require writing a lot of complex business logic in your code.

testimonials.name: Aleksandra Yarokhovich
testimonials.title: Business Analyst, Status
testimonials.quote: Collaborating on the SpiffWorkflow project has been a delight. Passionate team, open to ideas, and a powerful product combining BPMN with Python's agility. Best wishes for its success!

description: Mindtrails is a web-based research application that helps promote healthier patterns of thinking using interpretation bias training.  Since 2014, Sartography has provided software development and technical oversight to the PACT (Program for Anxiety, Cognition, and Treatment) Lab, run by Professor Bethany Teachman.  Written in Java Spring and Angular, the application meets the rigorous requirements of the University of Virginia for collecting and storing sensitive information about study participants, while also allowing us to remain in direct contact with those participants.

testimonials.name: Bethany Teachman PhD
testimonials.title: Professor, Department of Psychology
testimonials.quote: Sartography is deeply committed to helping clients realize their vision. The team is incredibly responsive to feedback and always willing to meet to answer questions. They routinely go ‘above and beyond’ to make the product the best it can be, and they are creative and excellent problem solvers.

description: ReCAP is a consortium made up of the New York Public Library, Columbia University, Harvard and Princeton.  The consortium shares a collection of 16 million physical items that is growing by a million items per year.  Sartography performed a rigorous review of a critical software application called SCSB.  We created a 75 page report, including detailed recommendations and a roadmap for achieving a new and more robust software architecture. We presented our findings in person at Columbia University in the fall of 2019 to a group with members from every institution, fielding questions from librarians, engineers and executives to fully address and defend our findings.

testimonials.name: A representative of ReCAP
testimonials.quote: Thank you so much for working with us and performing such a thoughtful and detailed review of SCSB. The report is clear, compelling, and easy to read even for a layman like me.

description: The Autism DRIVE is a 'bench to bedside' project that connects researchers and the community to accelerate advances in the support of people affected by autism.  We worked with Doctors Micha Mazurek and Rose Nevill to develop an easy to use website where people can find support throughout the state of Virginia, as well as sign up for current and future research studies.
organizationName: University of Virginia, Curry School of Education

description: Working with the Research Computing department of the School of Medicine at UVA we created a platform where students, community members, and faculty could sign up for free workshops offered across the campus.  Integrating with UVA’s two factor authentication system, we created a streamlined sign-up process.  To help users find the right classes we provide tools for organizing workshops into tracks - taking users from introductory materials to advanced specializations.

testimonials.name: Byoung-Do (BD) Kim
testimonials.title: Director of Research Computing
testimonials.quote: The Sartography team did excellent work for the development of CADRE Academy. Hundreds of UVA students are now taking advantage of the online platform for their search on workshop contents and upcoming classes. It was a great pleasure working with Dan.

description: The number of biomedical resources available to Researchers, Clinicians and the general public is exploding. An emerging discipline of Translational Medicine hopes to expedite the discovery of new tools and treatments in this multidisciplinary world. As a first step we helped create the iTrhiv Portal, a multi-institutional collaboration of Virginia universities and private organizations that helps everyone learn about and access information critical to their work and health.

testimonials.name: Johanna Loomba, BS, CCRC
testimonials.title: Research Concierge Services Manager
testimonials.quote: The Sartography team was creative, flexible, and efficient in their approaches to both requirements definition and system design.  Their commitment to quality and customer satisfaction was unflagging throughout the entire project period.

description: Full Genomes provides unusually detailed DNA sequencing to their clients. After some troubles with a previous consulting company they engaged us to get their development back on track. Our efforts included updating the e-commerce section of their website, integrating their backend processing, and updating the interface to a more modern look and feel that is mobile friendly.
